block.p: Lauren Eden Blick, the daughter of Elaine and Michael I. Blick of Jericho, N.Y., was married last evening to Thomas Charny Rotko, a son of Ruth Charny of New York and Michael J. Rotko of Unionville, Pa. Rabbi Marvin Antosofsky officiated at the Woodcrest Club in Syosset, N.Y.

The bride, 27, is a clinical social worker. Until recently, she was with the Pediatric Infectious Disease Clinic of Bellevue Hospital Center in New York. She graduated from Cornell University and received a master's degree in social work from Columbia. Her father is the president of Ro-El Productions, a company in Hicksville, N.Y., that publishes trade magazines. Her mother is a former substitute elementary teacher in the Jericho public schools.

Lauren Eden Blick, the daughter of Elaine and Michael I. Blick of Jericho, N.Y., was married last evening to Thomas Charny Rotko, a son of Ruth Charny of New York and Michael J. Rotko of Unionville, Pa. Rabbi Marvin Antosofsky officiated at the Woodcrest Club in Syosset, N.Y.

The bride, 27, is a clinical social worker. Until recently, she was with the Pediatric Infectious Disease Clinic of Bellevue Hospital Center in New York. She graduated from Cornell University and received a master's degree in social work from Columbia. Her father is the president of Ro-El Productions, a company in Hicksville, N.Y., that publishes trade magazines. Her mother is a former substitute elementary teacher in the Jericho public schools.

The bridegroom, 31, was until earlier this month an assistant district attorney in Manhattan. He graduated from Union College in Schenectady, N.Y., and received his law degree from the University of Pennsylvania. His mother is an independent film producer whose credits include ''Grace of My Heart'' and ''Search and Destroy.'' The bridegroom's father is of counsel to Drinker, Biddle & Reath, a law firm in Philadelphia. He is a stepson of Denise Rotko.
